snippet: The Haggler revisits the subject of cramming — the act of tacking on an unrequested service fee to a phone bill. Why, he asks, can’t cellphone carriers do more to thwart it?
abstract: David Segal The Haggler column on the subject of cramming, or the common practice among cellphone companies of tacking on an unrequested service fee to a phone bill; questions why carriers cannot, or will not, do more to stop it.
lead_paragraph: The Haggler revisits the subject of cramming — the act of tacking on an unrequested service fee to a phone bill. Why, he asks, can’t cellphone carriers do more to thwart it?

headline.print_headline: To Stop Cramming, Don’t Let It Start
headline.seo: Cellphone Cramming Gets a Second Look
headline.main: To Stop Cellphone Cramming, Don’t Let It Start
